column4: Anyone able to help out with Ubuntu/Grub reconizing a partition?
Haven't got a clue if I write GRUB to sda or sda1.
yeah, but the problem is, when I edit the menu.lst in grub, It still doesn't work
Your problem would be different from my problem...
I can't even force ubuntu to mount my XP partition
Like I said, I'm installing Arch, and I'm not sure where to write GRUB to. I'm trying to replace the windows MBR with GRUB, but I don't knwo if its on /dev/sda or /dev/sda1.
type in sudo fdisk -l in terminal, and see which one it is
it's usually the NTFS one XD
The Windows partition? That'll be sda1. Do boot loaders usually exist along side the operating system?
I'm here for help, I don't know all that much XD
That happens. I wonder if a windows disc + recovery console would do anything.
Well, I'm just gonna reinstall XP, this thing pisses me off too much, and I don't think I can fix it.
